meanings.definition: Igniting spontaneously upon contact with another substance.
meanings.sent1: The hypergolic reaction was immediate, causing a rapid burst of flames.
meanings.sent2: The hypergolic fuel ignited as soon as it touched the oxidizer.
meanings.sent3: The hypergolic chemicals were so eager to burn, they lit up like birthday candles.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like a hypergolic mixture, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The hypergolic nature of the fireworks made the display both thrilling and dangerous.

meanings.definition: A substance that ignites spontaneously upon contact with another substance.
meanings.sent1: The astronauts loaded the spacecraft with hypergolic propellants for a quick launch.
meanings.sent2: The engineers carefully handled the hypergolic to avoid accidental ignition.
meanings.sent3: The hypergolic leaked onto the launchpad, creating a fiery spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between them was like a hypergolic mixture, always on the edge of combustion.
meanings.sent5: The hypergolic substance was so volatile that even a tiny spark could set it off.
